newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Heung Chang sees profit rising sharply.
newsitem.headline: Heung Chang sees profit rising sharply.

text.p: South Korea's Heung Chang Products Co expects its sales and net profit to rise sharply this year in line with growing demand for telecommunications equipment, a senior company official told Reuters on Friday.
Choi Myung-jin, manager of Heung Chang's strategic planning department, said the company saw this year's after-tax net profit rising to 8.5 billion won from 4.28 billion in 1996.
"Demand for our products is growing rapidly as subscribers to various telecommunications services are increasing," Choi said by telephone.
He said annual sales were estimated to grow to 150 billion won this year from 88.07 billion won in 1996.
The company specialises in making facilities for cellular phone relay systems and radio paging systems, and other electric equipment such as testing instruments.
Heung Chang's customers include SK Telecom Co, the nation's largest provider of cellular phone and radio paging services, and provincial radio pager operators, he said.
Choi said he was confident that a consortium led by the company would be given a government licence to set up a cable television operation in the Koyang-Paju area near Seoul.
The area covers about 300,000 households and the cable service is expected to contribute to a sharp raising of Heung Chang's earnings, Choi said.
The licence is due to be handed over next week, he said.
Choi said the company's sales were projected to rise further to 250 billion won in 1998 and 400 billion won in 2000.
